eu.kidf.diversicon.core

Class Diversicon

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api.Uby
      • eu.kidf.diversicon.core.Diversicon

  • public class Diversicon
extends de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api.Uby
    Extension of Uby LMF knowledge base with some additional fields in the db to speed up computations. In particular, original SynsetRelation is extended by DivSynsetRelation by adding depth and provenance edges. To create instances use connectToDb(DivConfig) method

    Concurrency

    A Diversicon opens a hibernate Session with the DB upon instance creation, as Uby does. This implies a single instance of Diversicon cannot be shared among concurrent processes, see Hibernate documentation. TODO maybe it's possible to have one different instance per thread.

    Since:
    0.1.0

      • getConnectedSynsets

        public Iterator<de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.model.semantics.Synset> getConnectedSynsets(String synsetId,
                                                                          int depth,
                                                                          Iterable<String> relNames)
        Finds all of the synsets to which synsetId is connected with edges of relNames having depth less or equal the given one.
        Parameters:
        relNames - if none is provided an empty set iterator is returned.
        depth - the maximum depth edges can have. If -1 no depth limit is applied. If zero an empty set iterator is returned.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • importFiles

        public List<ImportJob> importFiles(ImportConfig importConfig)
        Imports lexical resource files. Each file import is going to be a separate transaction.

        In case one import fails, stops and tries to roll back as much as it can. (See issue 38 for more info on transactions)

        Throws:
        DivValidationException
        InterruptedImportException
        Since:
        0.1.0

                       eu.kidf.diversicon.core.LexResPackage pack,
                       boolean skipAugment)

      • importResource

        public ImportJob importResource(de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.model.core.LexicalResource lexRes,
                       eu.kidf.diversicon.core.LexResPackage pack,
                       ImportConfig importConfig)
        Saves a LexicalResource complete with all the lexicons, synsets, etc into a database. Call is synchronous, after finishing returns a log of the import.

        NOTE: This method is suitable only for small lexical resources, generally for testing purposes. If you have a big resource, stream the load process by providing your implementation of LMFDBTransformer and then call transform() on it instead.

        Parameters:
        importConfig - a configuration for the import. Must have only one file url.
        pack - A LexicalResource doesn't contain stuff like namespaces, so we have to provide them by ourselves in pack.
        Throws:
        InvalidImportException
        InterruptedImportException
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • connectToDb

        public static Diversicon connectToDb(DivConfig config)
        Creates an instance of a Diversicon and opens a connection to the db. Db must already exists. Present schema will be validated against required one and if it doesn't match InvalidSchemaException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        config - a Diversicon config
        Throws:
        eu.kidf.diversicon.core.exceptions.DivIoException
        InvalidSchemaException
        eu.kidf.diversicon.core.exceptions.DivException
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • exportToXml

        public void exportToXml(String outPath,
               String lexResName,
               boolean compress)
        Simple export to a UBY-LMF .xml file.
        Parameters:
        outPath - a path to a file, if compressed it is suggested to end with .xml.zip. If the path includes non-existing directories, they will be automatically created.
        lexResName - the name of the lexical resource to export.
        compress - if true file is compressed to zip
        Throws:
        eu.kidf.diversicon.core.exceptions.DivIoException - if file in xmlPath already exists or there are write errors.
        eu.kidf.diversicon.core.exceptions.DivNotFoundException - if lexicalResourceName does not exists.
        InvalidStateException - if database is not normalized
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • exportToSql

        public void exportToSql(String sqlPath,
               boolean compress)
        Exports to a .sql file. Currently, only supported db is H2.
        Parameters:
        sqlPath - a path to a file, which is suggested to end with .sql or .sql.zip, if compressed. If the path includes non-existing directories, they will be automatically created.
        compress - if true file is compressed to zip
        Throws:
        eu.kidf.diversicon.core.exceptions.DivIoException - if file in sqlPath already exists or there are write errors.
        Since:
        0.1.0

                          String targetSynsetId,

        See isInstanceConnected(String, String, int, String, List)

      • isInstanceConnected

        public boolean isInstanceConnected(String sourceSynsetId,
                          String targetSynsetId,
                          int depth,
                          String instanceRel,
                          List<String> relNames)
        Checks connection among paths starting with a specific relation, like i.e. hypernymInstance followed by hypernym) Works like isConnected(String, String, int, List), but checks also that first relation encountered equals instanceRel. Following links can be of any of the relations in relNames.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(String sourceSynsetId,
                  String targetSynsetId,
                  int depth,
                  List<String> relNames)
        Returns true if sourceSynset is connected to targetSynset with some relation relNames within given depth. This function only looks for edges already present in the database, without calculating new ones (except for known inverses).
        Parameters:
        sourceSynsetId - the source synset
        targetSynsetId - the target synset
        depth - the maximum edge depth for relations. if -1 no depth limit is applied. If zero returns true only if source and target coincide.
        relNames - the relation names (in particular see ERelNameSemantics). if none is provided returns true only if source and target coincide.
        Since:
        0.1.0
